website_summaries.verdict: The Fujifilm FinePix XP20 is a decent extra point-and-shoot for when you need a camera to take some abuse. But if it's going to be your one and only pocket camera, look elsewhere.
pros: The Fujifilm FinePix XP20 is an easy-to-use rugged point-and-shoot
cons: The XP20 has sluggish shooting performance and produces poor low-light photos

customer_reviews.title: Lots of my friends have Gopros but I like this.
customer_reviews.text: I had the Fujifilm FinePix model just before this one and it took less time between pictures. I have to wait with this camera and often miss shots. I abuse these cameras with water and freezing temps and they hold up very well. Mine have taken some falls too. Lots of my friends have Gopros but I like this.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: It's tougher than my kid...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for my teenage daughter with cerebral palsy. She loves to take pictures, but falls down a lot. We went through several cameras, always buying cheap ones, knowing they'd break. This one is amazing! Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Morris

customer_reviews.title: Bought as a gift
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my grandson as a gift. He loves it. He takes underwater shots in the bathtub. He records a lot of video, so he can run through a battery charge in a few hours. I ended up buying one for myself to keep in the motorcycle, since my other camera is a digital SLR, and doesn't do video. The camera with a car charger and I'm good to go.
customer_reviews.author: kenmen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is fantastic, I've had mine for about 2 years now. Its been dropped plenty, and went swimming plenty. Takes beautiful clear pictures, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: PugMotherOf3

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. Bad seals. MP don't look nearly as good as they should either. Very cheap and disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Adam S

customer_reviews.title: It's OK for the price
customer_reviews.text: I knew I wasn't getting the best camera ever. Just bought it for a trip I was doing. Worked good and still works.
customer_reviews.author: JosephU

customer_reviews.title: best underwater camera ever!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item as a gift to my step son and he loves it! he said its the best underwater camera ever. Even the photos & videos taken out of the water were remarkable. There are reviews saying that the lid ot the battery keeps on opening. it's not true. the one we got stays there and kept the battery and the camera safe and secure underwater.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Ann Herron

customer_reviews.title: WTF?
customer_reviews.text: Shot over 900 images, and 110 were ghost-lke files. They show up on Sd card as big files, BUt are un-viewable and not fixable to view (both Jpgs and movie files too (.avi). But a real camera, like a canon 60D. Lost shots of giant crater hverfall, where Tom$ cvruise filmed Oblivion in June 2012. Waaaeh!!!
customer_reviews.author: Icelanddad

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is good but I seam to get my thumb in the photo quite often. Takes great shots.
customer_reviews.author: Inspector

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: i love this camera it works so well! and at these prices i can afford to perchase accsesories and such foe the camera as well! so if u r debating wether or not to buy it i would because it is definitly worth it!
customer_reviews.author: delani 123

customer_reviews.title: Yes
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my dad for christmas, he likes it, so i'm happy, and it's practically indestructible. He takes it with him on his outdoor trips.
customer_reviews.author: Godslayer333

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: The camera was purchased for a Christmas gift; therefore, has not been used yet. But, packaging was great and I believe the product is new, so don't expect any difficulties with it. Seller was prompt in sending.
customer_reviews.author: afrisch

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this at Costco to replace an old Olympus Stylus tough that we lost. We used it for a home-made photobooth at our wedding and it worked fine. However, the first time we got into the water (on our honeymoon in Puerto Vallarta) it began to malfunction and show signs of water (ei, water drops in the battery/memory card area, fogging lens) and malfunctioning on-and-off. Our old stylus was fabulous and never had so many problems. Luckily we also brought along a kodak playsport video camera on the trip- if we'd left it up to this camera we'd have no documentation of our honeymoon. Had to return this item with discontent.
customer_reviews.author: C. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: We used the Fujifilm XP all summer at the lake that we keep our boat at, we also took this camera on a Southern Caribbean cruise. We went snorkeling and took some great pictures of sea turtles, fish & sea urchins. It worked great! Just make sure that your battery compartment is locked tight, push it down with some pressure and be sure it clicks locked. We are very happy with the underwater camera & the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine R

customer_reviews.title: Is truly waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I was at the beach, and the tide was coming in (not that i was paying that any mind), and all of a sudden, a HUGE wave comes and washes over all my stuff. My camera was with it all; everything was recovered except for my camera. About 15-20 min later, though, the camera was washed up onto the beach. I turn it on, and low and behold, it still worked. It takes good pictures too. Very worth-while, in my case.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: NOT WATERPROOF
customer_reviews.text: First off, if I could give this camera zero stars I would. We got this camera as a wedding present to be used on our honeymoon in the Dominican Republic. Luckily we packed two cameras, this camera only lasted about an hour. We took it out in the ocean, was under water only about 1 foot and afterwards camera read "card error" and we lost all photos on the memory card. Also water had seeped into the battery compartment and under the flash. Currently trying to exchange it because it is past the return time. Not a happy customer, will probably never use or count on this camera again.
customer_reviews.author: tracieszcz

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy...not waterprooof
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy...this camera is not waterproof. The door for battery doesn't stay shut and the camera gets ruined. Don't waste your money or your time with Fuji.
customer_reviews.author: g2

product_meta.title: Fujifilm FinePix XP20 Orange 14 MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom - Orange
product_meta.description: The FinePix XP20 offers a rugged and highly featured compact camera that will ensure outdoor loving photographers or adventure sports enthusiasts are well catered for. FinePix XP20 features 14 Megapixel resolution with an impressive 5 times wide angle optical zoom with optical image stabilization to achieve excellent image quality in any condition. The XP20 is housed in a chassis that is waterproof, dustproof, shockproof and freezeproof. With a FinePix XP20 in your backpack, outdoor photographers will be able to take their pictures to new heights.
feature_bullets: 4-Way Protection: Waterproof - 16.5 ft, Shockproof - 5ft, Freeze Proof 14F, Dust Proof

specifications.Customer Reviews: 2.8 out of 5 stars34 ratings2.8 out of 5 stars
